entry.title: DeepSeekr1 - A Free Web Interface for DeepSeek AI Models
entry.summary: dengyao1014: üëã Hello everyone! I'd like to share a project I've been working on - a web interface for DeepSeek AI models. üîç What is DeepSeekr? It's a platform that provides free access to DeepSeek AI models. No registration required, no API key needed - just open and start chatting. ‚ú® Key Features: ‚Ä¢ Supports both DeepSeek-7B and 67B models ‚Ä¢ Completely free to use ‚Ä¢ No registration required ‚Ä¢ Clean, minimalist interface ‚Ä¢ Fast response time üõ† Tech Stack: ‚Ä¢ Frontend: Next.js ‚Ä¢ Backend: Node.js ‚Ä¢ AI: DeepSeek API üîó Website: https://deepseekr1.site üí° Use Cases: ‚Ä¢ General conversation and Q&A ‚Ä¢ Programming assistance ‚Ä¢ Content creation ‚Ä¢ Learning and education üéØ Motivation: I noticed many people wanted to try DeepSeek models but were blocked by various barriers. So I developed this simple tool to help more people experience AI technology. üìù Future Plans: ‚Ä¢ Add more useful features ‚Ä¢ Optimize response speed ‚Ä¢ Support more models ‚Ä¢ Expand use case scenarios I welcome any feedback and suggestions. Feel free to try it out and leave your comments below. #AI #DeepSeek #OpenSource

entry.title: Thank You (2024 Edition)
entry.summary: I'm more thankful this time around because, last year, I didn't even get to write this post. But now that I'm back, writing this feels so, so, so good. There's a lot more gusto going into my writing when I say: thank you so very much! Let's tie a bow on this year and round up what happened around here in 2024. Thank You (2024 Edition) originally published on CSS-Tricks, which is part of the DigitalOcean family. You should get the newsletter.
